events.message: The claimant reported a car collision involving their vehicle and another car at an intersection during rush hour.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the description of the incident and the nature of damages reported.
An insurance claims agent was assigned to handle the case and reach out to the claimant for further details.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured timely assistance.
The claimant was asked to provide the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and a copy of the driver’s license.
All requested documents, including the accident report and photos of the damaged car, were submitted by the claimant.
The insurance company began investigating the circumstances of the collision and verifying the documentation provided.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of liability being partially on the claimant based on police findings.
A settlement offer was proposed to the claimant covering the vehicle repair costs minus the deductible.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the communication and timely response provided throughout the claim process.
The insurance claim was approved as per the settlement terms and scheduled payment disbursement was confirmed.
The agreed payment for the vehicle damage repair was issued to the claimant’s bank account successfully.
The insurance claim was officially closed following payment and confirmation that repair work had commenced.
All claim documents and records have been archived for future reference as per company policy.
